newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Paranagua/Santos sugar shipping conditions.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Paranagua/Santos sugar shipping conditions.

text.p: The Brazilian ports of Paranagua and Santos reported the following conditions for shipping sugar.

Vessels: Catherine H. loading 14,000 tonnes bagged sugar. Amanpulo loading 27,500 tonnes sugar using big bags. Waiting to dock, four vessels to load bagged sugar and three to load bulk. Road: 199 trucks carrying sugar arrived on July 31.
Loading (July 30): 1,852 tonnes using big bags and 908 tonnes bulk.

Vessels: Icarus, Seanav I and Libanus each loading 14,000 tonnes bagged sugar. Mattz Spica loading 12,000 tonnes bagged sugar. Searanger II loading 25,000 tonnes bulk sugar. Delta Freedom loading 13,125 tonnes sugar. Valentin Khutorsk loading 12,500 tonnes bagged sugar. Waiting to dock, three vessels to load bulk sugar. No vessels docked at Cargill private terminal. Waiting to dock, one vessel to load bulk sugar.
Stocks: 12,077 tonnes bulk in CODESP warehouses, no bagged sugar. Private warehouses already with bagged sugar but stock levels unavailable.
